file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-10-04-04 - CONFIG-2 - HEATED NIPPLES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL HEATED NIPPLES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the heated nipples. B. There are two heated nipples in the water system: • The water fill nipple and the water overflow nipple. C. The heaters are installed on the water fill nipple and on the water overflow nipple. Their function is to keep these points heated to prevent clogging when the water freezes. D. The heated nipple includes a metal flanged tube with an electrical heating blanket around it. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 38-10-04-000-802-A HEATED NIPPLES - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) 38-10-04-400-802-A HEATED NIPPLES - INSTALLATION EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 38-10-04 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-10-04-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. HEATED NIPPLES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the heated water fill nipple and the heated water overflow nipple. (2) To get access to the heated water fill nipple and to the heated water overflow nipple, you must remove the baggage compartment floor lining and the baggage compartment floor panel from that area, and open the water service-panel door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400 MOVAL S.B.145-38-0002 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193NR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-011-A (1) Make sure the water tank is empty. (2) Remove the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-10-04 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (4) Open water service-panel door 193NR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-011-A (1) Release the electrical connections (1). (2) Disconnect the heated nipple fittings (2). (3) Remove the sealant from the nuts (4), washers (5), and heated nipple bases. (4) On aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-38-0002, remove the screw (9), nuts (11) and washers (10) from water service panel door 193NR. (5) Remove the screws (3), nuts (4), and washers (5) from the heated nipples (6). (6) Remove the caps (8) from the water fill nipple and the water overflow nipple. (7) Remove the heated nipples (6). (8) Remove and discard the gaskets (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-10-04 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-38-0002 Heated Nipples - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 162 B ZONE 193 B 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTION 2. FITTING 2. FITTING 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTION 1 C 1 DET. A 4. NUT 4. NUT 5. WASHER 5. WASHER 6. HEATED NIPPLE 6. HEATED NIPPLE 7. GASKET 7. GASKET SEALANT VIEW C 5. WASHER 5. WASHER 3. SCREW 3. SCREW DET. B 8. CAP 1 APPLY GREASE GGA80TF/B OR KRYTOX240AC OR KRYTOX240AZ ONLY TO THE FIRST TWO SCREW THREADS OF THE UPPER ENDS OF THE HEATED NIPPLES. ELECTRICAL 1 DET. A CONNECTION 3 3 4. NUT C 4. NUT 5. WASHER 5. WASHER 6. HEATED NIPPLE 6. HEATED NIPPLE 7. GASKET 7. GASKET B 2 DET. A 5. WASHER 5. WASHER SEALANT 3. SCREW 3. SCREW 10. WASHER 8. CAP DET. B 9. SCREW 11. NUT 10. WASHER 1 UP TO S/N 339 VIEW C 2 S/N 340 AND ON 3 APPLY GREASE GGA80TF/B OR KRYTOX240AC OR KRYTOX240AZ ONLY EM145AMM380046D.DGN TO THE FIRST TWO SCREW THREADS OF THE UPPER ENDS OF THE HEATED NIPPLES. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-10-04-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. HEATED NIPPLES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the heated water fill nipple and the heated water overflow nipple. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 12-15-01-600-801-A/300 WATER TANK - FILLING BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400 STALLATION IPC 38-10-04 WATER FILL AND OVERFLOW NIPPLES S.B.145-38-0002 - SRM 51-20-01 - WM 38-10-50 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193NR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-38249 Sealant PR-812 AR MEP08-017 Grease GGA80TF/B AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Gasket IPC 38-10-04 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-10-04 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-011-A (1) Install new gaskets (7) in the heated nipples (6). CAUTION: BEFORE YOU CONNECT THE HEATED NIPPLES TO THE CAPS AND TO THE FITTINGS, APPLY GREASE GGA80TF/B ONLY TO THE FIRST TWO SCREW THREADS OF THE TWO ENDS OF THE HEATED NIPPLES. (2) Put the heated nipples (6) and the cap (8) attachment cables in position, and attach the heated nipples with the screws (3), nuts (4), and washers (5). (3) Apply the sealant to the nuts (4), washers (5), and heated nipple bases (SRM 51-20-01). (4) Connect the heated nipple fittings (2). (5) Do the electrical connections (1) (WM 38-10-50). (6) On aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-38-0002, install the screw (9), washers (10) and nuts (11) in water service panel door 193NR. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-011-A (1) Install baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (2) Install the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400). (3) Fill the water tank ( AMM TASK 12-15-01-600-801-A/300). (4) Install the heated nipple caps (8). (5) Close water service-panel door 193NR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-10-04 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
